dt: {bc}a person who creates art (such as painting, sculpture, music, or writing) using conscious skill and creative imagination
{bc}a person skilled in any of the arts

dt.t: I can't draw at all, but both of my children are very talented {wi}artists{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a person who is very good at something
{bc}one skilled or versed in learned arts

et: borrowed from Middle French {it}artiste{/it} "person practicing a craft, student of the liberal arts," borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}artista{/it} "artificer, student of the liberal arts," from Latin {it}art-, ars{/it} "acquired skill, {et_link|art:1|art:1}" + {it}-ista{/it} {et_link|-ist:1|-ist:1}
shortdef: a person who creates art (such as painting, sculpture, music, or writing) using conscious skill and creative imagination
a person skilled in any of the arts
a skilled performer; especially : a musical or theatrical entertainer : artiste

dt: {bc}someone (such as a performer or criminal) unusually adept at escaping from confinement

shortdef: someone (such as a performer or criminal) unusually adept at escaping from confinement

dt: {bc}a person who tricks other people in order to get their money

dt.t: The couple lost their savings to a {it}con artist{/it} who told them he was an investment broker.

shortdef: a person who tricks other people in order to get their money

dt: {bc}a person who performs music for recordings

shortdef: a person who performs music for recordings

dt: {bc}an art form in which the artist's intent is to convey a concept rather than to create an art object

shortdef: an art form in which the artist's intent is to convey a concept rather than to create an art object

dt: {bc}three-dimensional art made from discarded material (such as metal, mortar, glass, or wood)

shortdef: three-dimensional art made from discarded material (such as metal, mortar, glass, or wood)

dt: {bc}art (such as sculpture or {d_link|assemblage|assemblage}) having mechanical parts which can be set in motion

shortdef: art (such as sculpture or assemblage) having mechanical parts which can be set in motion

dt: {bc}any of several arts of combat and self-defense (such as karate and judo) that are widely practiced as sport

shortdef: any of several arts of combat and self-defense (such as karate and judo) that are widely practiced as sport

dt: {bc}a nontraditional art form often with political or topical themes that typically features a live presentation to an audience or onlookers (as on a street) and draws on such arts as acting, poetry, music, dance, or painting

shortdef: a nontraditional art form often with political or topical themes that typically features a live presentation to an audience or onlookers (as on a street) and draws on such arts as acting, poetry, music, dance, or painting
